entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 2:06AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Cooler Temps Sunday Night through Tuesday... Heavy rain showers move into the Fortymile Uplands Sunday afternoon and move west into the Chena River Basin and Eastern Alaska Range Sunday night and Memorial Day. Periods of copious rainfall will result in an area of 1 to 3 inches of rainfall from
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 2:34PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Continues Along the Yukon River And Lower Nowitna Rivers... Water is still slowly draining back into the Yukon and Nowitna River with water levels remaining near bankfull. Snowmelt runoff currently moving down the Yukon River will cause water levels to remain elevated and near bankfull into next week.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 28 at 7:01AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Higher than normal water levels in creeks and streams in Inyo County through the Memorial Day Weekend... Even though snowmelt flow rates peaked early in the week, automated stream gauges indicate creeks continue to run high and fast with cold water. Temperatures are forecast to hover a few degrees from average through the Memorial Day Weekend suggesting streamflows will
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 8:39PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES THROUGH MEMORIAL DAY... * Scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms will continue each afternoon through Memorial Day. entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 12:00PM MDT until May 29 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of rain falling on a snowpack will continue to accelerate runoff due to snowmelt. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and are expected to remain above bankfull through the weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues.

entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS TODAY... Dry conditions will lead to elevated fire weather conditions today. entry.summary: ...NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MINNESOTA AND NORTHWEST WISCONSIN... Dry conditions will lead to near critical fire weather conditions today. entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 10:38AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Temperatures remain warm enough to allow for mountain snowpack to continue melting in the higher elevations of the Salt River Range. entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 10:28AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton Wyoming has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .Temperatures remain warm enough to allow for mountain snowpack to continue melting in the surrounding mountains.
